translated: the ten perfections of the bodhisattva and the ten bodhisattva stages are accomplished.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de snying rje chen po sngon du btang ba'i sems bskyed pa byung ba re re zhing yang /
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de snying rje chen po sngon du btang ba'i sems bskyed pa byung ba re re zhing yang /
translated: Because in each thought of the bodhisattva mahāsattva,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos yang dag par bsgrub pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi don du yongs su bsngo bas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos yang dag par bsgrub pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi don du yongs su bsngo bas /
translated: They dedicate it to the attainment of the qualities of the Buddha and to the attainment of the wisdom of the Tathāgatas.

original: de la gang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes yongs su tshol zhing /
analyzed: de la gang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes yongs su tshol zhing /
translated: “Here, the pursuit of the wisdom of the Buddha🔽and the dedication of the roots of virtue to all beings is the perfection of generosity of the bodhisattva.

original: sems can rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su gtong ba 'di ni de'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o; ;gang nyon mongs pa'i yongs su gdung ba thams cad rab tu zhi ba 'di ni de'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su gtong ba 'di ni de'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o; ;gang nyon mongs pa'i yongs su gdung ba thams cad rab tu zhi ba 'di ni de'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The pacification of all the torments of the afflictions is the perfection of morality of the bodhisattva.

original: gang snying rje dang byams pa sngon du 'gro bas sems can thams cad la 'tshig pa med pa 'di ni de'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: gang snying rje dang byams pa sngon du 'gro bas sems can thams cad la 'tshig pa med pa 'di ni de'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The absence of anger toward any being, preceded by compassion and love, is the perfection of patience of the bodhisattva.

original: gang gong nas gong du dge ba'i chos tshol pas mi ngoms par dam 'cha' ba 'di ni de'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: gang gong nas gong du dge ba'i chos tshol pas mi ngoms par dam 'cha' ba 'di ni de'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The commitment to never be satisfied with the higher and higher qualities of virtue is the perfection of effort of the bodhisattva.

original: gang thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes mngon du bya ba'i phyir 'gyod pa med pa'i lam dang ldan pa 'di ni de'i bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: gang thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes mngon du bya ba'i phyir 'gyod pa med pa'i lam dang ldan pa 'di ni de'i bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of his concentration is that he has the path of no regret in order to manifest the wisdom of omniscience.

original: gang rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa mngon du gyur pa 'di ni de'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //🔽gang ye shes tshad med pa mngon par bsgrub pa 'di ni de'i @160a *//
analyzed: gang rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa mngon du gyur pa 'di ni de'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o // gang ye shes tshad med pa mngon par bsgrub pa 'di ni de'i @160a *//
translated: The perfection of his wisdom is that he manifests the unborn.

original: thabs mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: thabs mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of his skillful means is that he accomplishes immeasurable wisdom.

original: gang gong nas gong du ye shes la dmigs shing mngon par bsgrub pa 'di ni de'i smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: gang gong nas gong du ye shes la dmigs shing mngon par bsgrub pa 'di ni de'i smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of his aspiration is that he focuses on and accomplishes higher and higher wisdom.

original: gang phas kyi rgol ba thams cad dang / bdud kyi tshogs thams cad kyis lam yongs su mi chod pa 'di ni de'i stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: gang phas kyi rgol ba thams cad dang / bdud kyi tshogs thams cad kyis lam yongs su mi chod pa 'di ni de'i stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of his power is that he is not obstructed on the path by any opponents or any hosts of demons.

original: gang chos thams cad la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtog pa 'di ni de'i ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: gang chos thams cad la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtog pa 'di ni de'i ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of knowledge is the correct understanding of all phenomena just as they are.

original: kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /
analyzed: kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /
translated: O children of the Victorious Ones,

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa'i sa ring du song ba 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bcu po de dag de ltar yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa'i sa ring du song ba 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bcu po de dag de ltar yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
translated: in this way, the ten perfections of the bodhisattva who abides on this bodhisattva ground Far Reaching are perfected.

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi yang yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi yang yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The four means of gathering disciples are also perfected.

original: byin gyi rlabs bcu dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang / mdor bsdu na byang chub kyi yan lag gi chos thams cad skad cig skad cig tu yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byin gyi rlabs bcu dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang / mdor bsdu na byang chub kyi yan lag gi chos thams cad skad cig skad cig tu yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The ten blessings, the thirty-seven factors of awakening, the three doors of liberation, and in short, all the factors of awakening are perfected in every moment.

original: de skad ces smras pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnam par grol ba'i zla bas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rdo rje'i snying po la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de skad ces smras pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnam par grol ba'i zla bas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rdo rje'i snying po la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: The bodhisattva Vimukti candra then said to the bodhisattva mahāsattva Vajra garbha:🔽

original: kye; rgyal ba'i sras /🔽ci byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po /
analyzed: kye; rgyal ba'i sras / ci byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po /
translated: The bodhisattva Vimukti candra then asked the bodhisattva mahāsattva Vajra garbha, “O son of the victors!

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa 'di @160b la gnas pa 'ba' zhig gis byang chub kyi yan lag thams cad skad cig skad cig tu yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ram /🔽'on te ma yin gyi /🔽sa bcu po thams cad la'ang de bzhin du yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur /🔽byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying pos smras pas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa 'di @160b la gnas pa 'ba' zhig gis byang chub kyi yan lag thams cad skad cig skad cig tu yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ram / 'on te ma yin gyi / sa bcu po thams cad la'ang de bzhin du yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur / byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying pos smras pas /
translated: What is the name of this seventh bhūmi of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas?”

original: kye; rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye; rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: The bodhisattva Vajra garbha replied, “O son of the victors!🔽This bhūmi of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas is called the Gone Far.🔽Why is it called the Gone Far?🔽O son of the victors, it is because the bodhisattva mahāsattvas who are on this bhūmi have gone far from the level of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.🔽They have gone far from the level of the bodhisattva.🔽They have gone far from the level of the bodhisattva mahāsattva.🔽They have gone far from the level of the tathāgata.🔽They have gone far from the level of the arhat.🔽They have gone far from the level of the pratyekabuddha.

original: sa bcu po kun la yang byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub kyi yan lag thams cad skad cig skad cig tu yongs su rdzogs par lta 'gyur te /
analyzed: sa bcu po kun la yang byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub kyi yan lag thams cad skad cig skad cig tu yongs su rdzogs par lta 'gyur te /
translated: They have gone far from the level of the bodhisattva mahāsattva.🔽They have gone far from the level of the tathāgata.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa 'di la ni de dag pas lhag par yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa 'di la ni de dag pas lhag par yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: On this seventh bodhisattva stage, they are even more complete.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: kye; rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye; rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: O child of the conquerors!

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa 'di ni nan tan du bya ba'i spyod pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa ye shes dang / mngon par shes pa'i spyod pa yongs su gnon pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa 'di ni nan tan du bya ba'i spyod pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa ye shes dang / mngon par shes pa'i spyod pa yongs su gnon pa ste /
translated: This bodhisattva stage is the completion of the practice of effort, the mastery of the practice of wisdom and super-knowledge.

original: de ltar / kye; rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: de ltar / kye; rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: O child of the conquerors!

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po la ni smon lam thams cad la lhag par dmigs pas byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub kyi yan lag thams cad yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po la ni smon lam thams cad la lhag par dmigs pas byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub kyi yan lag thams cad yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: On the first bodhisattva stage, all the branches of enlightenment of the bodhisattvas are completed by the bodhisattvas’ special focus on all aspirations.

original: gnyis pa la sems kyi dri ma thams cad gsal bas /
analyzed: gnyis pa la sems kyi dri ma thams cad gsal bas /
translated: On the second, they are purified by the purification of the mind.

original: gsum pa la smon lam rnam par 'phel ba dang / chos kyi snang ba thob pas /
analyzed: gsum pa la smon lam rnam par 'phel ba dang / chos kyi snang ba thob pas /
translated: On the third, they are increased by the increase of aspirations and by the attainment of the light of the Dharma.

original: bzhi pa la lam la 'jug pas /
analyzed: bzhi pa la lam la 'jug pas /
translated: On the fourth, they are entered by the entry into the path.

original: lnga pa la 'jig rten gyi spyod pa'i rjes su 'brang bas /
analyzed: lnga pa la 'jig rten gyi spyod pa'i rjes su 'brang bas /
translated: On the fifth, they are followed by the following of worldly conduct.

original: drug pa la chos zab mo'i sgor 'jug pas byang chub kyi yan lag thams cad @161a *//
analyzed: drug pa la chos zab mo'i sgor 'jug pas byang chub kyi yan lag thams cad @161a *//
translated: On the sixth ground, by entering the gateway of the profound Dharma, all the branches of enlightenment are perfected.

original: yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te; byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa 'di la ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su sgrub pas byang chub kyi yan lag thams cad skad cig skad cig tu yongs su grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te; byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa 'di la ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su sgrub pas byang chub kyi yan lag thams cad skad cig skad cig tu yongs su grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: On this seventh bodhisattva ground, all the branches of enlightenment are perfected in every moment, because all the qualities of buddhahood are accomplished.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po nas bzung ste /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po nas bzung ste /
translated: Why is that?

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa'i bar du byang chub sems dpas mngon par bsgrubs pa'i ye shes mngon par sgrub pa'i sbyor ba'i yan lag de dag byang chub sems dpa' sa brgyad pa yan chad lhun gyis grub par yongs su 'grub bo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa'i bar du byang chub sems dpas mngon par bsgrubs pa'i ye shes mngon par sgrub pa'i sbyor ba'i yan lag de dag byang chub sems dpa' sa brgyad pa yan chad lhun gyis grub par yongs su 'grub bo //
translated: From the first bodhisattva ground up to the seventh bodhisattva ground, the branches of application for accomplishing the wisdom that is accomplished by the bodhisattva are accomplished spontaneously by the bodhisattva on the eighth ground and above.

original: kye; rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye; rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: “O son of the victors!

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: dper na / kun nas nyon mongs shing rnam par dag pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams dang / shin tu dag pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams dag gi 'jig rten gyi khams gnyis kyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi bar ni smon lam dang / thabs dang / shes rab dang /
analyzed: dper na / kun nas nyon mongs shing rnam par dag pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams dang / shin tu dag pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams dag gi 'jig rten gyi khams gnyis kyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi bar ni smon lam dang / thabs dang / shes rab dang /
translated: For example, the two worlds of a defiled and pure world system and a completely pure world system cannot be crossed over except by the power and force of a vow, method, wisdom,

original: mngon par shes pa'i stobs dang / shugs chen po ma gtogs par 'dod 'dod brgal bar mi nus so //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa'i stobs dang / shugs chen po ma gtogs par 'dod 'dod brgal bar mi nus so //
translated: and superknowledge.

original: kye; rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye; rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: “O Son of the Victorious One!

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa 'dres pa dang / yongs su dag pa'i bar yang smon lam dang / thabs dang / shes rab dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ye shes kyi stobs dang / shugs chen po ma gtogs par 'dod 'dod brgal bar mi nus so //
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa 'dres pa dang / yongs su dag pa'i bar yang smon lam dang / thabs dang / shes rab dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ye shes kyi stobs dang / shugs chen po ma gtogs par 'dod 'dod brgal bar mi nus so //
translated: In the same way, the two worlds of a mixed and a completely pure bodhisattva conduct cannot be crossed over except by the power and force of a vow, method, wisdom, superknowledge, and knowledge.🔽”

original: byang @161b chub sems dpa' rnam par grol ba'i zla bas smras pa /
analyzed: byang @161b chub sems dpa' rnam par grol ba'i zla bas smras pa /
translated: The bodhisattva Vimukti candra said,

original: kye; rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye; rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: “O Son of the Victorious One!

original: 'o na ci byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun rnams la /
analyzed: 'o na ci byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun rnams la /
translated: Well then, what are the seven bodhisattva stages?🔽🔽

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa nyon mongs pa'i spyod pas kun nas nyon mongs par yid ches par bya ba yin nam /🔽byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying pos smras pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa nyon mongs pa'i spyod pas kun nas nyon mongs par yid ches par bya ba yin nam / byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying pos smras pa /
translated: “Well then, are the seven bodhisattva stages to be trusted as being completely afflicted by the conduct of afflictions in the conduct of bodhisattvas?”

original: kye; rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye; rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: Bodhisattva Vajra garbha said, “O Son of the Victorious Ones!

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po rab tu dga' ba nyid bzung ba yan chad du byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad byang chub tu yongs su bsngos pa'i dbang gis nyon mongs pa'i rnyog pa dang bral bar gar 'os pa'i tshul gyis lam mnyam pa nyid
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po rab tu dga' ba nyid bzung ba yan chad du byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad byang chub tu yongs su bsngos pa'i dbang gis nyon mongs pa'i rnyog pa dang bral bar gar 'os pa'i tshul gyis lam mnyam pa nyid
translated: From the first bodhisattva stage, the Joyous, onwards, all the conduct of bodhisattvas is free from the turbidity of afflictions in the manner of being suitable, through the power of having fully dedicated to awakening.

original: kyis yid ches par bya ste /
analyzed: kyis yid ches par bya ste /
translated: This is to be trusted through the path of sameness.

original: de tsam gyis sa bdun po rnams su nyon mongs pa'i spyod pa las yang dag par 'das zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: de tsam gyis sa bdun po rnams su nyon mongs pa'i spyod pa las yang dag par 'das zhes mi bya'o //
translated: However, merely through that, it is not said that on the seven stages one has completely transcended the conduct of afflictions.

original: kye; rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye; rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: O Son of the Victorious Ones!

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this.

original: dper na / 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po ni lha rdzas kyi glang po rin po che la zhon zhing gling bzhi dag tu 'ang 'gro /
analyzed: dper na / 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po ni lha rdzas kyi glang po rin po che la zhon zhing gling bzhi dag tu 'ang 'gro /
translated: For example, a universal monarch, riding on the precious elephant of the gods, goes to the four continents

original: mi'i sdug bsngal dang / phongs pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i nyes pa rnams kyang rab tu shes te /
analyzed: mi'i sdug bsngal dang / phongs pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i nyes pa rnams kyang rab tu shes te /
translated: and knows the sufferings, poverty, and afflictions of humans,

original: 'on kyang nyes pa de dag gis gos par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang nyes pa de dag gis gos par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: but he is not affected by those faults.

original: de tsam gyis mi'i lus las yongs su 'das pa'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: de tsam gyis mi'i lus las yongs su 'das pa'ang ma yin te /
translated: But he has not transcended the human body by that much alone.

original: nam mi'i lus spangs te tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du skyes par gyur pa de'i tshe ni tshangs pa'i gzhal med khang na gnas shing /
analyzed: nam mi'i lus spangs te tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du skyes par gyur pa de'i tshe ni tshangs pa'i gzhal med khang na gnas shing /
translated: When he has abandoned the human body and is born in the world of Brahmā, then he dwells in the palace of Brahmā,

original: stong gi 'jig rten gyi khams kyang mthong /
analyzed: stong gi 'jig rten gyi khams kyang mthong /
translated: sees the world system of a thousand worlds,

original: de dag du'ang 'gro /🔽tshangs pa'i gzugs @162a *//
analyzed: de dag du'ang 'gro / tshangs pa'i gzugs @162a *//
translated: and goes there too.

original: brnyan yang kun tu ston te /
analyzed: brnyan yang kun tu ston te /
translated: He manifests the form of Brahmā

original: mi zhes kyang mi brjod do //
analyzed: mi zhes kyang mi brjod do //
translated: and is not called a human.

original: kye / rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye / rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: “O Son of the Victorious One!

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po bzung ba yan chad /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po bzung ba yan chad /
translated: In the same way, from the time of taking up the first bodhisattva ground,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa la zhon zhing 'gro ba thams cad du rgyu ba'i tshe /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa la zhon zhing 'gro ba thams cad du rgyu ba'i tshe /
translated: When the bodhisattva travels in all realms by means of the vehicle of the perfections,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i nyes pa rnams kyang rab tu shes te /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i nyes pa rnams kyang rab tu shes te /
translated: he also knows the faults of the afflictive emotions.

original: yang dag pa'i lam du zhugs pas kun nas nyon mongs pa de dag gis gos par yang mi 'gyur ro //🔽'on kyang de tsam gyis sa bdun po rnams la /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lam du zhugs pas kun nas nyon mongs pa de dag gis gos par yang mi 'gyur ro // 'on kyang de tsam gyis sa bdun po rnams la /
translated: But because he has entered the true path, he is not affected by those afflictive emotions.

original: nyon mongs pa'i nyes pa rnams las yang dag par 'das zhes ni mi bya ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i nyes pa rnams las yang dag par 'das zhes ni mi bya ste /
translated: However, it is not said that he has completely transcended the faults of the afflictive emotions on the seven levels.

original: nam sbyor ba can gyi spyod pa thams cad spangs te /
analyzed: nam sbyor ba can gyi spyod pa thams cad spangs te /
translated: When he has abandoned all the practices of the stage of application,

original: sa bdun po nas sa brgyad pa yongs su non par gyur te /
analyzed: sa bdun po nas sa brgyad pa yongs su non par gyur te /
translated: and has ascended from the seventh to the eighth level,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa yongs su dag pa la zhon zhing 'gro ba thams cad du rgyu ba'i tshe /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa yongs su dag pa la zhon zhing 'gro ba thams cad du rgyu ba'i tshe /
translated: when the bodhisattva travels in all realms by means of the completely pure vehicle of the bodhisattvas,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i nyes pa thams cad kyang rab tu shes te /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i nyes pa thams cad kyang rab tu shes te /
translated: he also knows all the faults of the afflictive emotions.

original: 'jig rten gyi bya ba kun las 'das pas nyes pa de dag gis kun nas nyon mongs par gyur ces mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi bya ba kun las 'das pas nyes pa de dag gis kun nas nyon mongs par gyur ces mi bya'o //
translated: Since he has transcended all worldly activities, he should not be said to be defiled by those faults.

original: kye / rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye / rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: “O Son of the Victorious One!

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa mang po thams cad las kyang shin tu shas che bar 'da' ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa mang po thams cad las kyang shin tu shas che bar 'da' ste /
translated: The Bodhisattva who abides in this seventh Bodhisattva ground has transcended all the many afflictions such as attachment.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa 'di la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de ni nyon mongs pa can zhes kyang mi @162b bya; nyon mongs pa med pa zhes kyang mi bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa 'di la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de ni nyon mongs pa can zhes kyang mi @162b bya; nyon mongs pa med pa zhes kyang mi bya'o //
translated: The Bodhisattva who practices on this seventh Bodhisattva ground should not be called defiled, nor should he be called undefiled.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad rgyu ba med pas nyon mongs pa can zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad rgyu ba med pas nyon mongs pa can zhes mi bya'o //
translated: He should not be called defiled because all the afflictions do not operate.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes mngon par 'dod cing bsam pa yongs su ma rdzogs pas nyon mongs pa med pa zhes kyang mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes mngon par 'dod cing bsam pa yongs su ma rdzogs pas nyon mongs pa med pa zhes kyang mi bya'o //
translated: He should not be called undefiled because he has not fulfilled his wish for the wisdom of the Tathāgata.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni lhag pa'i bsam pas yongs su dag pa'i lus kyi las dang ldan pa yin /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni lhag pa'i bsam pas yongs su dag pa'i lus kyi las dang ldan pa yin /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva who is on this seventh bodhisattva stage possesses physical activity that is completely pure in its intention.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pas yongs su dag pas ngag gi las dang ldan pa yin /
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pas yongs su dag pas ngag gi las dang ldan pa yin /
translated: He possesses verbal activity that is completely pure in its intention.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pas yongs su dag pa'i yid kyi las dang ldan pa yin /
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pas yongs su dag pa'i yid kyi las dang ldan pa yin /
translated: He possesses mental activity that is completely pure in its intention.

original: de ni 'di ltar mi dge ba'i las kyi lam de bzhin gshegs pas smad pa kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa de dag las thams cad kyi thams cad du yang dag par 'das pa yin /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar mi dge ba'i las kyi lam de bzhin gshegs pas smad pa kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa de dag las thams cad kyi thams cad du yang dag par 'das pa yin /
translated: In this way, he has completely transcended all the paths of nonvirtuous action that were condemned by the Tathāgata and that are associated with the mental afflictions.

original: gang 'di dag dge ba'i lam yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bsngags pa de dag gi rjes su rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par 'brang ba yin /
analyzed: gang 'di dag dge ba'i lam yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bsngags pa de dag gi rjes su rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par 'brang ba yin /
translated: He always and continuously follows the paths of virtuous action that were praised by the perfect Buddha.

original: gang yang byang chub sems dpa'i sa lnga pa la bzo'i gnas dang / las kyi gnas ji ltar mngon par bsgrubs pa de dag thams cad kyang lhun gyis grub pa rab tu 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gang yang byang chub sems dpa'i sa lnga pa la bzo'i gnas dang / las kyi gnas ji ltar mngon par bsgrubs pa de dag thams cad kyang lhun gyis grub pa rab tu 'byung ngo //
translated: Whatever the bodhisattva has accomplished in the five crafts and occupations, all that is spontaneously accomplished.

original: de ni stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na slob dpon du bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de ni stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na slob dpon du bya ba yin te /
translated: He is a master in the trichiliocosm,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa brgyad pa yan chad kyi @163a *//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa brgyad pa yan chad kyi @163a *//
translated: except for the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, and the bodhisattvas on the eighth and higher stages.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ma gtogs par su yang de dang bsam pa'am sbyor bas mnyam pa med de; 'di ltar yang gang 'di dag bsam gtan rnams dang; ting nge 'dzin dag dang / snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / mngon par shes pa dag dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ma gtogs par su yang de dang bsam pa'am sbyor bas mnyam pa med de; 'di ltar yang gang 'di dag bsam gtan rnams dang; ting nge 'dzin dag dang / snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / mngon par shes pa dag dang /
translated: No one is equal to him in thought or action, because he has attained the concentrations, liberations, samādhis, samāpattis, and higher knowledges.

original: rnam par thar pa rnams kyang thams cad kyi thams cad du bsgom pa mngon par bsgrub pa'i sgo'i tshul gyis mngon du 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa rnams kyang thams cad kyi thams cad du bsgom pa mngon par bsgrub pa'i sgo'i tshul gyis mngon du 'gyur te /
translated: The liberations also manifest for him, through the mode of accomplishing the cultivation of all aspects.

original: 'on kyang da dung byang chub sems dpa'i sa brgyad pa la ji ltar de bzhin du ni rnam par smin pas yongs su rdzogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang da dung byang chub sems dpa'i sa brgyad pa la ji ltar de bzhin du ni rnam par smin pas yongs su rdzogs pa ma yin no //
translated: But they are not yet fully perfected by the maturation of his faculties, as they are on the eighth bodhisattva stage.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i sems bskyed pa thams cad la shes rab dang thabs dang bsgom pa'i stobs yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i sems bskyed pa thams cad la shes rab dang thabs dang bsgom pa'i stobs yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, for the bodhisattva who is in this seventh bodhisattva stage, all the mental states that are generated are perfected in terms of the power of wisdom, the power of means, and the power of cultivation.

original: sngon pas kyang byang chub kyi yan lag thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa rab tu 'thob bo //
analyzed: sngon pas kyang byang chub kyi yan lag thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa rab tu 'thob bo //
translated: And he attains the perfection of all the factors for enlightenment to a much greater degree than before.

original: de de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa 'di la gnas pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa 'di la gnas pa'i tshe /
translated: When he is in this seventh bodhisattva stage,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin rnam par dbye ba shin tu rnam par phye ba zhes bya ba la mnyam par gzhog ste /🔽byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin don shin tu bsam pa zhes bya ba dang / khyad par gyi blo gros zhes bya ba dang / rab tu phye ba'i don gyi mdzod ces bya ba dang / chos ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par 'byed pa zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin rnam par dbye ba shin tu rnam par phye ba zhes bya ba la mnyam par gzhog ste / byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin don shin tu bsam pa zhes bya ba dang / khyad par gyi blo gros zhes bya ba dang / rab tu phye ba'i don gyi mdzod ces bya ba dang / chos ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par 'byed pa zhes bya ba dang /
translated: He entered the bodhisattva absorption called the extremely detailed analysis of distinctions,🔽the bodhisattva absorption called the extremely contemplated meaning, the one called the special mind, the one called the treasury of the meaning of the distinctions, the one called the differentiation of phenomena just as they are,

original: rtsa ba shin tu gnas pas @163b bstan pa zhes bya ba dang / ye shes dang mngon par shes pa'i sgo zhes bya ba dang / chos kyi dbyings yongs su sbyangs pa zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan zhes bya ba dang; don sna tshogs kyi mdzod 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i sgo zhes bya ba la yang mnyam par gzhog ste /
analyzed: rtsa ba shin tu gnas pas @163b bstan pa zhes bya ba dang / ye shes dang mngon par shes pa'i sgo zhes bya ba dang / chos kyi dbyings yongs su sbyangs pa zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan zhes bya ba dang; don sna tshogs kyi mdzod 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i sgo zhes bya ba la yang mnyam par gzhog ste /
translated: the one called the teaching of the extremely stable root, the one called the gateway of wisdom and higher knowledge, the one called the purification of the realm of phenomena, the one called the qualities of the tathāgatas, and the one called the gateway to saṃsāra and nirvāṇa, the treasury of various meanings.

original: de dag la sogs pa mngon par shes pa dang / ye shes chen po sgo'i ting nge 'dzin sa yongs su sbyong bar byed pa brgya stong phrag bcu tshang ba la snyoms par 'jug go /
analyzed: de dag la sogs pa mngon par shes pa dang / ye shes chen po sgo'i ting nge 'dzin sa yongs su sbyong bar byed pa brgya stong phrag bcu tshang ba la snyoms par 'jug go /
translated: He enters into ten hundred thousand such samādhis that are gateways to great higher knowledge and wisdom, and that purify the bhūmis.

original: de thabs dang shes rab kyis yongs su sbyang ba'i ting nge 'dzin de dag rab tu thob pa dang / snying rje dang snying brtse ba'i mthus nyan thos kyi sa las 'das pa yin /
analyzed: de thabs dang shes rab kyis yongs su sbyang ba'i ting nge 'dzin de dag rab tu thob pa dang / snying rje dang snying brtse ba'i mthus nyan thos kyi sa las 'das pa yin /
translated: “He attains those samādhis that are purified by means of wisdom and method, and through the power of his compassion and love he transcends the level of the śrāvakas.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las 'das pa yin /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las 'das pa yin /
translated: He transcends the level of the pratyekabuddhas.

original: shes rab dang ye shes kyis rnam par dpyad pa'i sa mngon sum du gyur pa yin /
analyzed: shes rab dang ye shes kyis rnam par dpyad pa'i sa mngon sum du gyur pa yin /
translated: He actualizes the bhūmi that is analyzed by means of wisdom and knowledge.

original: de ltar de byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa 'di la gnas pa'i tshe /🔽lus kyi las tshad med pa mtshan ma dang bral bar rab tu 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de ltar de byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa 'di la gnas pa'i tshe / lus kyi las tshad med pa mtshan ma dang bral bar rab tu 'byung ngo //
translated: “In that way, when he is on this seventh bodhisattva bhūmi,🔽he manifests immeasurable physical actions that are free of signs.

original: ngag gi las tshad med pa mtshan ma dang bral ba rab tu 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ngag gi las tshad med pa mtshan ma dang bral ba rab tu 'byung ngo //
translated: He manifests immeasurable verbal actions that are free of signs.

original: yid kyi las tshad med pa mtshan ma dang bral ba shin tu rnam par sbyangs pa mi skye ba'i chos kyi bzod pas snang bar gyur pa tshad med pa rab tu 'byung ngo /🔽byang chub sems dpa' rnam par grol ba'i zla bas smras pa /
analyzed: yid kyi las tshad med pa mtshan ma dang bral ba shin tu rnam par sbyangs pa mi skye ba'i chos kyi bzod pas snang bar gyur pa tshad med pa rab tu 'byung ngo / byang chub sems dpa' rnam par grol ba'i zla bas smras pa /
translated: “The immeasurable activity of the mind, free of signs, completely purified, and illuminated by the acceptance of the nonarising of phenomena, arises immeasurably.🔽”

original: kye / rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye / rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: The bodhisattva Vimukti candra declared, “O son of the victors,

original: de lta go /🔽byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po la gnas pa'i tshe'ang byang chub sems dpa'i lus dang / @164a *//
analyzed: de lta go / byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po la gnas pa'i tshe'ang byang chub sems dpa'i lus dang / @164a *//
translated: it is so.

original: ngag dang yid kyi las tshad med pa nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi spyod pa las yang dag par 'das na ci rob /🔽byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying pos smras pa /
analyzed: ngag dang yid kyi las tshad med pa nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi spyod pa las yang dag par 'das na ci rob / byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying pos smras pa /
translated: When a bodhisattva is on the first bodhisattva stage, the immeasurable activity of the bodhisattva’s body, speech, and mind transcends the conduct of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.🔽”

original: kye / rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye / rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: The bodhisattva Vajra garbha declared, “O son of the victors,

original: de lta'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta'ang ma yin te /
translated: it is not so.

original: de ni sangs rgyas kyi chos la dmigs pa'i mthur zad kyi rang gi blos rnam par dpyad pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni sangs rgyas kyi chos la dmigs pa'i mthur zad kyi rang gi blos rnam par dpyad pa ni ma yin no //
translated: That is merely the power of focusing on the qualities of the Buddha, but it is not the power of one’s own mind.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa 'di la ni rang gi blo'i spyod yul rnam par dpyod pa rab tu thob pas nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis mi 'phrogs pa yin /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa 'di la ni rang gi blo'i spyod yul rnam par dpyod pa rab tu thob pas nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis mi 'phrogs pa yin /
translated: On this seventh bodhisattva stage, the bodhisattva attains the full realization of the domain of his own intellect and is thus unassailable by all the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: kye / rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye / rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: “O son of the victorious ones!

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: dper na / rgyal po'i rigs su skyes pa'i rgyal po'i mtshan dang ldan pa ni btsas ma thag tu rgyal po'i byin gyis blon po'i tshogs thams cad zil gyis gnon gyi /
analyzed: dper na / rgyal po'i rigs su skyes pa'i rgyal po'i mtshan dang ldan pa ni btsas ma thag tu rgyal po'i byin gyis blon po'i tshogs thams cad zil gyis gnon gyi /
translated: A prince born into the royal caste, who bears the marks of a king, from the moment of his birth surpasses the assembly of ministers by the power of his royal status,

original: rang gi blos rnam par dpyad pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi blos rnam par dpyad pas ni ma yin no //
translated: not by the power of his own intellect.

original: nam nar son par gyur pa de'i tshe rang gi blo'i mthus blon po thams cad kyi byed pa'i tshul las shin tu 'das pa yin /
analyzed: nam nar son par gyur pa de'i tshe rang gi blo'i mthus blon po thams cad kyi byed pa'i tshul las shin tu 'das pa yin /
translated: When he has grown up, by the power of his own intellect he surpasses the activities of all the ministers.

original: kye / rgyal ba'i sras; de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'ang sems bskyed ma thag tu lhag pa'i bsam pa'i bdag nyid chen pos nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad zil gyis gnon te //
analyzed: kye / rgyal ba'i sras; de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'ang sems bskyed ma thag tu lhag pa'i bsam pa'i bdag nyid chen pos nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad zil gyis gnon te //
translated: O Son of the Victorious Ones, in the same way, as soon as the bodhisattva has given rise to the mind of awakening, he surpasses all the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas through the greatness of his superior intention.

original: rang gi blos rnam par brtags pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi blos rnam par brtags pas ni ma yin no //
translated: He does not do so through his own intellectual analysis.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni rang gi yul gyi ye shes kyi stobs kyis shugs @164b kyis nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi byed pa'i tshul las shin tu 'das pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni rang gi yul gyi ye shes kyi stobs kyis shugs @164b kyis nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi byed pa'i tshul las shin tu 'das pa yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva who is on this seventh bodhisattva ground, through the power of his wisdom with regard to his own object, surpasses the way of acting of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas through the force of his own power.

original: kye / rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye / rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: O Son of the Victorious Ones,

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa 'di la gnas pa'i tshe /🔽lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las zab cing dben la /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa 'di la gnas pa'i tshe / lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las zab cing dben la /
translated: in this way, when the bodhisattva mahāsattva is on this seventh bodhisattva ground,🔽he attains the profound and secluded activity of body, speech, and mind,

original: rgyu ba med pa dang ldan pa'ang rab tu thob pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyu ba med pa dang ldan pa'ang rab tu thob pa yin te /
translated: which is free from movement.

original: khyad par gong du btsal ba'i brtson 'grus kyang yongs su mi gtong ngo //
analyzed: khyad par gong du btsal ba'i brtson 'grus kyang yongs su mi gtong ngo //
translated: In particular, they do not give up the effort they have made in the past.

original: yongs su btsal ba'i brtson 'grus des kyang yang dag pa'i mthar gnas pa la'ang khyad par gong ma shin tu thob par bya ba'i phyir yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du'ang mi byed do //
analyzed: yongs su btsal ba'i brtson 'grus des kyang yang dag pa'i mthar gnas pa la'ang khyad par gong ma shin tu thob par bya ba'i phyir yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du'ang mi byed do //
translated: And by that effort they do not actualize the limit of reality, in order to attain the higher, superior limit of reality.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnam par grol ba'i zla bas smras pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnam par grol ba'i zla bas smras pa /
translated: The bodhisattva Vimukti candra declared,

original: kye / rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye / rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: “O child of the conquerors!

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa gang yan chad du byang chub sems dpa'i 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa gang yan chad du byang chub sems dpa'i 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug /
translated: From what level of bodhisattva does the bodhisattva enter into the absorption of cessation?

original: byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying pos smras pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying pos smras pa /
translated: The bodhisattva Vajra garbha declared,

original: kye / rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye / rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: “O child of the conquerors!

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa drug pa yan chad byang chub sems dpa'i 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa drug pa yan chad byang chub sems dpa'i 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug ste /
translated: From the sixth bodhisattva level, the bodhisattva enters into the absorption of cessation.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni sems skad cig re re la yang 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni sems skad cig re re la yang 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug ste /
translated: The bodhisattva who is on this seventh bodhisattva stage enters into cessation in every instant of mind.

original: 'gog pa mngon du byas zhes ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa mngon du byas zhes ni mi bya'o //
translated: But it is not said that he has realized cessation.

original: de bas na de ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las dang ldan zhes bya ba yin no //🔽kye / @165a *//
analyzed: de bas na de ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las dang ldan zhes bya ba yin no // kye / @165a *//
translated: Therefore, he is said to have inconceivable actions of body, speech, and mind.

original: rgyal ba'i sras dag /
analyzed: rgyal ba'i sras dag /
translated: “O children of the Victorious Ones!

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' yang dag pa'i mtha' la gnas pas kyang gnas la /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' yang dag pa'i mtha' la gnas pas kyang gnas la /
translated: The bodhisattva who abides in the limit of reality abides in the limit of reality,

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du yang mi byed pa ni ngo mtshar che'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du yang mi byed pa ni ngo mtshar che'o //
translated: but does not realize the limit of reality. This is truly amazing!

original: kye / rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye / rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: O children of the Victorious Ones!

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: dper na / mi la la zhig rgya mtsho chen po'i gru chen por zhugs te /
analyzed: dper na / mi la la zhig rgya mtsho chen po'i gru chen por zhugs te /
translated: Suppose a person were to board a large ship on the great ocean.

original: rgal ba'i thabs la mkhas shing rlung la mkhas pa dang / chu la mkhas pa ni /
analyzed: rgal ba'i thabs la mkhas shing rlung la mkhas pa dang / chu la mkhas pa ni /
translated: Skilled in the means of crossing over, skilled in the wind, and skilled in the water,

original: rgya mtsho chen po'i chu'i nyes pas mi gos so //
analyzed: rgya mtsho chen po'i chu'i nyes pas mi gos so //
translated: he would not be affected by the faults of the water of the great ocean.

original: kye / rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye / rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: O son of the victorious ones!

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po /
translated: In the same way, the bodhisattva great beings

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa 'di la gnas shing pha rol tu phyin pa'i gru chen por zhugs pa yang yang dag pa'i mtha' la gnas pas kyang gnas la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa 'di la gnas shing pha rol tu phyin pa'i gru chen por zhugs pa yang yang dag pa'i mtha' la gnas pas kyang gnas la /
translated: who are on this seventh bodhisattva ground, and who have embarked on the great ship of the perfections, abide in the limit of reality,

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du yang mi byed do //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du yang mi byed do //
translated: but they do not actualize the limit of reality.

original: de ltar de ye shes kyi stobs dang shugs thob pa ni ting nge 'dzin dang / ye shes kyi stobs dang shugs kyis mngon par bsgrubs pa'i blo dang / thabs dang shes rab kyi stobs dang / shugs chen pos 'khor pa'i sgo yang ston la /
analyzed: de ltar de ye shes kyi stobs dang shugs thob pa ni ting nge 'dzin dang / ye shes kyi stobs dang shugs kyis mngon par bsgrubs pa'i blo dang / thabs dang shes rab kyi stobs dang / shugs chen pos 'khor pa'i sgo yang ston la /
translated: In this way, having attained the power and strength of wisdom, with the power and strength of samādhi and wisdom, with the power and strength of method and wisdom, they manifest the gateway of saṃsāra,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i bsam pa dang yang mi 'bral ba yin /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i bsam pa dang yang mi 'bral ba yin /
translated: but they are never separate from the intention of nirvāṇa.

original: 'khor mang pos kun nas bskor bar snang yang rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par sems kyi dben pa'ang rab tu thob pa yin /
analyzed: 'khor mang pos kun nas bskor bar snang yang rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par sems kyi dben pa'ang rab tu thob pa yin /
translated: They appear to be surrounded by a great retinue, but they always and continuously attain mental solitude.

original: khams gsum du skye ba yang smon lam gyi dbang gis mngon par sgrub la /
analyzed: khams gsum du skye ba yang smon lam gyi dbang gis mngon par sgrub la /
translated: They manifest birth in the three realms through the power of their aspirations.

original: 'jig rten gyi nyes pas kyang mi gos pa yin /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi nyes pas kyang mi gos pa yin /
translated: They are not sullied by the faults of the world.🔽They are peaceful and completely peaceful,

original: zhi zhing rab tu zhi ba yin @165b la; thabs kyis rab tu 'bar te /
analyzed: zhi zhing rab tu zhi ba yin @165b la; thabs kyis rab tu 'bar te /
translated: but they blaze with skillful means.

original: de ltar 'bar yang tshig par mi 'gyur ba yin /
analyzed: de ltar 'bar yang tshig par mi 'gyur ba yin /
translated: Even though they blaze, they are not burned.

original: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la'ang yongs su 'jug la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la'ang yongs su 'jug la /
translated: They engage with the wisdom of the buddhas,

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyis las kyang phyir mi ldog pa yin /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyis las kyang phyir mi ldog pa yin /
translated: but they do not turn back from the activities of the hearers and solitary buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi yul gyi mthil du yang phyin la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi yul gyi mthil du yang phyin la /
translated: They have arrived at the essence of the domain of the buddhas,

original: bdud kyi yul na'ang 'dug par snang ba yin /
analyzed: bdud kyi yul na'ang 'dug par snang ba yin /
translated: but they appear to be in the domain of the māras.

original: bdud kyi lam bzhi las kyang yang dag par 'das la bdud kyi yul dang spyod yul yang yang dag par ston pa yin /
analyzed: bdud kyi lam bzhi las kyang yang dag par 'das la bdud kyi yul dang spyod yul yang yang dag par ston pa yin /
translated: They have transcended the four paths of the māras, but they also demonstrate the domain and sphere of activity of the māras.

original: mu stegs can gyi gnas thams cad na'ang 'dug par snang la /
analyzed: mu stegs can gyi gnas thams cad na'ang 'dug par snang la /
translated: They appear to be in all the abodes of the tīrthikas,

original: sangs rgyas kyi mu stegs kyi gnas kyi bsam pa yang mi gtong ba yin /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mu stegs kyi gnas kyi bsam pa yang mi gtong ba yin /
translated: but they do not abandon the intention of the buddhas’ domain of the tīrthikas.

original: 'jig rten gyi bya pa thams cad dang yang ldan par snang la /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi bya pa thams cad dang yang ldan par snang la /
translated: He appears to have all worldly activities,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i tshul la yang yang dag par gzhol ba yin /🔽lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang / mi dang / mi ma yin pa dang / brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten gyi mgon po thams cad las lhag pa'i rgyan dang /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i tshul la yang yang dag par gzhol ba yin / lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang / mi dang / mi ma yin pa dang / brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten gyi mgon po thams cad las lhag pa'i rgyan dang /
translated: and yet he is dedicated to the transcendent way.

original: lhab lhub shin tu bsgrub pa'ang rab tu thob la /
analyzed: lhab lhub shin tu bsgrub pa'ang rab tu thob la /
translated: He has attained the ornaments and adornments that surpass those of all gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, demigods, garuḍas, kinnaras, mahoragas, humans, and nonhumans, Śakra, Brahmā, and the Lokapālas.

original: chos la dga' ba yid la bya ba'ang mi spong ba yin /
analyzed: chos la dga' ba yid la bya ba'ang mi spong ba yin /
translated: And yet he does not abandon the mental activity of delighting in the Dharma.

original: de ltar de lta bu'i ye shes dang ldan par byang chub sems dpa'i sa ring du song ba 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de'i lta ba rgya chen po dang / smon lam gyi stobs kyis sangs rgyas mang po snang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar de lta bu'i ye shes dang ldan par byang chub sems dpa'i sa ring du song ba 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de'i lta ba rgya chen po dang / smon lam gyi stobs kyis sangs rgyas mang po snang bar 'gyur te /
translated: “In that way, the bodhisattva who has the wisdom of this bodhisattva bhūmi Gone Far, through the power of his vast view and his prayers, sees many buddhas.

original: lta ba rgya chen po dang smon lam gyi stobs kyis sangs rgyas brgya phrag mang po @166a *//
analyzed: lta ba rgya chen po dang smon lam gyi stobs kyis sangs rgyas brgya phrag mang po @166a *//
translated: Through the power of his vast view and aspirations, he will behold many hundreds of buddhas,🔽many thousands of buddhas, many hundreds of thousands of buddhas,🔽many millions of buddhas, many tens of millions of buddhas,

original: dang; sangs rgyas stong phrag mang po dang / sangs rgyas brgya stong phrag mang po dang / sangs rgyas bye ba brgya stong phrag mang po dang / sangs rgyas khrag khrig mang po dang / sangs rgyas khrag khrig brgya phrag mang po dang / sangs rgyas khrag khrig stong phrag mang po dang /
analyzed: dang; sangs rgyas stong phrag mang po dang / sangs rgyas brgya stong phrag mang po dang / sangs rgyas bye ba brgya stong phrag mang po dang / sangs rgyas khrag khrig mang po dang / sangs rgyas khrag khrig brgya phrag mang po dang / sangs rgyas khrag khrig stong phrag mang po dang /
translated: many billions of buddhas, many tens of billions of buddhas,

original: sangs rgyas khrag khrig brgya stong phrag mang po dang / sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag mang po snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas khrag khrig brgya stong phrag mang po dang / sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag mang po snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: many trillions of buddhas, and many quintillions of buddhas.

original: des de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag mthong nas /
analyzed: des de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag mthong nas /
translated: Having seen those tathāgatas, those arhats, those samyaksaṃbuddhas,

original: bsam pa rgya chen pos rim gro byed do //🔽bkur sti byed do //🔽bsti stang byed do //
analyzed: bsam pa rgya chen pos rim gro byed do // bkur sti byed do // bsti stang byed do //
translated: he will serve them with a vast attitude.🔽He will honor them,🔽revere them,

original: mchod par byed do //
analyzed: mchod par byed do //
translated: and make offerings to them.

original: na bza' dang / bsod snyoms dang / gzims cha dang / snyun gyi rkyen sman dang / yo byad dag kyang 'bul zhing /
analyzed: na bza' dang / bsod snyoms dang / gzims cha dang / snyun gyi rkyen sman dang / yo byad dag kyang 'bul zhing /
translated: He offers them clothing, alms, bedding, medicine for curing the sick, and all the necessities of life.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bde ba'i yo byad thams cad kyang yongs su 'bul lo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bde ba'i yo byad thams cad kyang yongs su 'bul lo //
translated: He offers them all the requisites of happiness of the Bodhisattvas.

original: dge 'dun gyi tshogs rnams la yang yang dag par mchod pa byed de /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi tshogs rnams la yang yang dag par mchod pa byed de /
translated: He also makes offerings to the assemblies of the Sangha.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo'o //
translated: He dedicates all those roots of virtue to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa de dag la bsnyen bkur byed cing /
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa de dag la bsnyen bkur byed cing /
translated: In this way, he attends to those Tathagatas.

original: de dag las rje sa dang / rim gros nan tan du chos bstan pa nyan cing len to //
analyzed: de dag las rje sa dang / rim gros nan tan du chos bstan pa nyan cing len to //
translated: He listens to the Dharma that they teach with respect and reverence, and he receives it.

original: 'dzin to // thos nas kyang ma nor ba'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / shes rab dang ye shes kyi snang bas rab tu brtson par byed cing nan tan gyis @166b yongs su 'dzin to //
analyzed: 'dzin to // thos nas kyang ma nor ba'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / shes rab dang ye shes kyi snang bas rab tu brtson par byed cing nan tan gyis @166b yongs su 'dzin to //
translated: He holds it, and having heard it, he practices it with the light of meditation, wisdom, and knowledge, and he holds it with perseverance.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi bstan pa yang yang dag par 'dzin to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi bstan pa yang yang dag par 'dzin to //
translated: He upholds the teachings of those Buddha Bhagavats.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi mngon par rtogs pa yongs su dri bas kyang mi 'phrogs pa yin te /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi mngon par rtogs pa yongs su dri bas kyang mi 'phrogs pa yin te /
translated: He is not carried away by questions about the realizations of the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas.

original: de sngon pas kyang sems can la phan 'dogs pa'i chos kyi bzod pa rnam par dag par 'gyur ba yin /
analyzed: de sngon pas kyang sems can la phan 'dogs pa'i chos kyi bzod pa rnam par dag par 'gyur ba yin /
translated: He becomes even more pure in the Dharma patience that benefits sentient beings.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i sa ring du song ba 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sngon pas kyang bskal pa du ma dang / bskal pa brgya phrag du ma dang / bskal pa stong phrag du ma dang /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i sa ring du song ba 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sngon pas kyang bskal pa du ma dang / bskal pa brgya phrag du ma dang / bskal pa stong phrag du ma dang /
translated: In that way, the roots of virtue of the Bodhisattva who is in this far-reaching Bodhisattva ground become even more purified over many eons, over many hundreds of eons, over many thousands of eons, over many hundreds of thousands of eons.

original: bskal pa brgya stong phrag du ma dang / bskal pa bye ba brgya stong phrag du ma dang / bskal pa khrag khrig phrag du ma dang / bskal pa khrag khrig brgya phrag du ma dang / bskal pa khrag khrig stong phrag du ma dang /
analyzed: bskal pa brgya stong phrag du ma dang / bskal pa bye ba brgya stong phrag du ma dang / bskal pa khrag khrig phrag du ma dang / bskal pa khrag khrig brgya phrag du ma dang / bskal pa khrag khrig stong phrag du ma dang /
translated: for many hundreds of thousands of eons, for many billions of eons, for many trillions of eons, for many quadrillions of eons, for many quintillions of eons,

original: bskal pa khrag khrig brgya stong phrag du ma dang / bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag du mar shin tu dag cing yongs su byang bar gnas so //
analyzed: bskal pa khrag khrig brgya stong phrag du ma dang / bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag du mar shin tu dag cing yongs su byang bar gnas so //
translated: for many sextillions of eons, for many septillions of eons, for many octillions of eons, for many nonillions of eons, for many undecillions of eons, for many duodecillions of eons, for many tredecillions of eons, for many quattuordecillions of eons, for many pentadecilllions of eons, for many hexadecillions of eons, for many heptadecillions of eons, for many octadecillions of eons, for many enneadecillions of eons, and for many vigintillions of eons.

original: kye / rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye / rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: “O jinaputras!

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: dper na / gser gyi sa le spram de nyid rin po che thams cad kyis rab tu spras pa ni sngon pas kyang rgyan gyi rnam pa gzhan dang gzhan gyis mi thub pa dang / ches 'od gsal zhing dang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na / gser gyi sa le spram de nyid rin po che thams cad kyis rab tu spras pa ni sngon pas kyang rgyan gyi rnam pa gzhan dang gzhan gyis mi thub pa dang / ches 'od gsal zhing dang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: For example, that same piece of gold, when it is adorned with all jewels, cannot be surpassed by any other kind of ornament, and it becomes even more radiant and pure.

original: kye / rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye / rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: “O jinaputras!

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po /
translated: In the same way, the bodhisattva mahāsattva

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa ring du song ba 'di la gnas pa'i @167a *//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa ring du song ba 'di la gnas pa'i @167a *//
translated: Bodhisattvas who are on this bodhisattva bhūmi, Gone Far,🔽

original: thabs dang shes rab kyis bsgrubs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sngon pas kyang ches shin tu byang ba dang / ches 'od gsal zhing dang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab kyis bsgrubs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag sngon pas kyang ches shin tu byang ba dang / ches 'od gsal zhing dang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “The roots of virtue of the bodhisattva who is in this far-reaching bodhisattva bhūmi are purified, brighter, and clearer than before, through his accomplishment of wisdom and skillful means.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis kyang mi 'phrogs pa yin /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis kyang mi 'phrogs pa yin /
translated: They cannot be surpassed by any śrāvakas or pratyekabuddhas.

original: kye / rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye / rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: “O jinaputras!

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: dper na / nyi ma'i 'od ni skar ma'i tshogs dang / zla ba'i 'od kyis mi 'phrogs shing 'dzam bu'i gling na rlan gyi bag yod pa thams cad kyang shin tu skam par byed do //
analyzed: dper na / nyi ma'i 'od ni skar ma'i tshogs dang / zla ba'i 'od kyis mi 'phrogs shing 'dzam bu'i gling na rlan gyi bag yod pa thams cad kyang shin tu skam par byed do //
translated: The light of the sun cannot be surpassed by the light of the stars and the moon, and it dries up all the moisture in Jambudvīpa.

original: kye / rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye / rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: “O jinaputras!

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i sa ring du song ba 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang sngon pas kyang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis mi 'phrogs pa yin /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i sa ring du song ba 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang sngon pas kyang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis mi 'phrogs pa yin /
translated: In the same way, the roots of virtue of the bodhisattva who is in this far-reaching bodhisattva bhūmi are not surpassed by those of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: phyin ci log bzhi dang ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa'i rlan gyi rnam pa thams cad kyang yongs su skem mo //
analyzed: phyin ci log bzhi dang ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa'i rlan gyi rnam pa thams cad kyang yongs su skem mo //
translated: All the moisture of the afflictions that are associated with the four errors is completely dried up.

original: de'i pha rol tu phyin pa bcu las thabs mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i shas che ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i pha rol tu phyin pa bcu las thabs mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i shas che ba yin te /
translated: From among the ten perfections, the perfection of skillful methods is predominant.

original: lhag ma rnams kyang ci tshul ci nus su mi sgrub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams kyang ci tshul ci nus su mi sgrub pa ma yin no //
translated: However, this does not mean that he does not practice the others according to his ability and opportunity.

original: kye / rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye / rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: “O jinaputras!

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis ring du song ba zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis ring du song ba zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is the bodhisattva bhūmi of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas called far-reaching.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: This concludes the exposition of the seventh bodhisattva bhūmi.

original: de la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phal cher lha'i rgyal po dbang sgyur du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phal cher lha'i rgyal po dbang sgyur du 'gyur te /
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattvas who are on that bhūmi mostly become Śakra, king of the gods.

original: @167b sems can rnams la mngon par rtogs pa'i ye shes yang dag par bstan pa la mkhas shing mthu med pa ste /
analyzed: @167b sems can rnams la mngon par rtogs pa'i ye shes yang dag par bstan pa la mkhas shing mthu med pa ste /
translated: They are skilled and powerful in teaching beings the wisdom of realization.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis yongs su dri bas mi zad pa yin /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis yongs su dri bas mi zad pa yin /
translated: They are inexhaustible in being questioned by all the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: sems can skyon med par shin tu bslab par bya ba la'ang mkhas pa yin te /🔽sbyin pa'am / ngag snyan pa'am /🔽don bsgrub pa'am /
analyzed: sems can skyon med par shin tu bslab par bya ba la'ang mkhas pa yin te / sbyin pa'am / ngag snyan pa'am / don bsgrub pa'am /
translated: They are skilled in training beings in the absence of faults.🔽Whatever roots of virtue they create, whether through generosity, kind words,🔽beneficial actions,

original: don mthun pas dge ba'i rtsa ba gang ci rtsom yang rung ste /
analyzed: don mthun pas dge ba'i rtsa ba gang ci rtsom yang rung ste /
translated: or consistency,

original: de thams cad ji ltar na sems can thams cad kyi mchog tu 'gyur /🔽gtso bor 'gyur /
analyzed: de thams cad ji ltar na sems can thams cad kyi mchog tu 'gyur / gtso bor 'gyur /
translated: they do so with the motivation, ‘How can I become supreme among all beings?🔽How can I become the best?

original: thu bor 'gyur /🔽phul du 'gyur /
analyzed: thu bor 'gyur / phul du 'gyur /
translated: How can I become the foremost?🔽How can I become the most excellent?

original: dam par 'gyur /
analyzed: dam par 'gyur /
translated: How can I become the most sublime?

original: bla na med par 'gyur /
analyzed: bla na med par 'gyur /
translated: How can I become the unsurpassed?

original: 'dren par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'dren par 'gyur /
translated: How can I become a leader?

original: yongs su 'dren par 'gyur ba nas thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la rten pa'i bar du 'gyur snyam ste /
analyzed: yongs su 'dren par 'gyur ba nas thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la rten pa'i bar du 'gyur snyam ste /
translated: I will become a guide, up to I will become one who is based in the wisdom of omniscience.

original: sangs rgyas yid la bya ba dang / chos yid la bya ba dang / dge 'dun yid la bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' yid la bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yid la bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa yid la bya ba dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas yid la bya ba dang / chos yid la bya ba dang / dge 'dun yid la bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' yid la bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yid la bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa yid la bya ba dang /
translated: He is never separated from keeping in mind the Buddha, keeping in mind the Dharma, keeping in mind the Saṅgha, keeping in mind the bodhisattvas, keeping in mind the bodhisattva activities, keeping in mind the bodhisattva levels,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa yid la bya ba dang / stobs yid la bya ba dang / mi 'jigs pa yid la bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa yid la bya ba dang / rnam pa'i mchog thams cad dang ldan pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi bar du yid la bya ba dang mi 'bral ba yin te /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa yid la bya ba dang / stobs yid la bya ba dang / mi 'jigs pa yid la bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa yid la bya ba dang / rnam pa'i mchog thams cad dang ldan pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi bar du yid la bya ba dang mi 'bral ba yin te /
translated: keeping in mind the perfections, keeping in mind the powers, keeping in mind the fearlessnesses, keeping in mind the distinct attributes of a buddha, up to keeping in mind the knowledge of all aspects and all modes.

original: de 'dod na skad cig yud tsam thang cig tu ting nge 'dzin bye ba @168a *//
analyzed: de 'dod na skad cig yud tsam thang cig tu ting nge 'dzin bye ba @168a *//
translated: If he wishes, in one instant, in one moment, in one second, he enters a billion meditative stabilities.

original: khrag khrig brgya stong rab tu thob cing de dag la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong mthong ba dang / de dag gi byin gyi rlabs kyang yang dag par shes pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong snang bar bya ba dang /
analyzed: khrag khrig brgya stong rab tu thob cing de dag la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong mthong ba dang / de dag gi byin gyi rlabs kyang yang dag par shes pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong snang bar bya ba dang /
translated: They attain, enter into, and arise from a hundred thousand quintillion meditative absorptions; they see a hundred thousand quintillion buddhas; they understand the blessings of those buddhas; they illuminate a hundred thousand quintillion world systems;

original: sems can bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong yongs su smin par bya ba dang / bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du gnas par bya ba dang / sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong mang po la rab tu 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: sems can bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong yongs su smin par bya ba dang / bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du gnas par bya ba dang / sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong mang po la rab tu 'jug pa dang /
translated: they ripen a hundred thousand quintillion beings; they remain for a hundred thousand quintillion eons; they engage with a hundred thousand quintillion previous and future eons;

original: chos kyi sgo bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong rnam par 'byed pa dang / lus bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong yongs su bstan pa dang / lus re re la yang byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong yang dag par bstan par bya ba'i brtson 'grus kyi rnam pa de lta bu rtsom mo //
analyzed: chos kyi sgo bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong rnam par 'byed pa dang / lus bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong yongs su bstan pa dang / lus re re la yang byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong yang dag par bstan par bya ba'i brtson 'grus kyi rnam pa de lta bu rtsom mo //
translated: They strive with such an effort that they open a trillion doors of Dharma, they manifest a trillion bodies, and they manifest a retinue of a trillion bodhisattvas for each body.

original: de yan chad byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam gyi mthu can rnams smon lam gyi khyad par gyis rnam par 'phrul te /
analyzed: de yan chad byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam gyi mthu can rnams smon lam gyi khyad par gyis rnam par 'phrul te /
translated: Beyond that, bodhisattvas who have the power of aspiration manifest through the particularities of their aspirations.

original: de dag gi lus sam /
analyzed: de dag gi lus sam /
translated: Their bodies,🔽their light,

original: 'od dam / rdzu 'phrul lam /
analyzed: 'od dam / rdzu 'phrul lam /
translated: their miracles,🔽their eyes,

original: mig gam / spyod yul lam /
analyzed: mig gam / spyod yul lam /
translated: their range,🔽their voices,

original: dbyangs sam / spyod pa'am /
analyzed: dbyangs sam / spyod pa'am /
translated: their conduct,🔽their ornaments,

original: rgyan tam / byin gyi rlabs sam /
analyzed: rgyan tam / byin gyi rlabs sam /
translated: and their blessings🔽are inconceivable.

original: mos pa'am / mngon par 'du byed pa dag kyang bskal pa du ma dang / bskal pa brgya phrag du ma dang / bskal pa stong phrag du ma dang / bskal @168b pa brgya stong phrag du ma dang / bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag du ma'i bar gyis kyang bgrang bar dka'o //
analyzed: mos pa'am / mngon par 'du byed pa dag kyang bskal pa du ma dang / bskal pa brgya phrag du ma dang / bskal pa stong phrag du ma dang / bskal @168b pa brgya stong phrag du ma dang / bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag du ma'i bar gyis kyang bgrang bar dka'o //
translated: It is difficult to count them even for many eons, many hundreds of eons, many thousands of eons, many hundreds of thousands of eons, many millions of eons, many tens of millions of eons, many billions of eons, many tens of billions of eons, many trillions of eons, or even many quintillions of eons.🔽Then the bodhisattva Vajra garbha, in order to analyze and teach the meaning of this stage, recited these verses:🔽“The sixth stage is called The Manifest.🔽The bodhisattvas who dwell on it🔽are always intent on the ultimate truth,

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying pos sa'i don 'di nyid yang brtag par bya ba dang / bstan par bya ba'i phyir de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so //
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying pos sa'i don 'di nyid yang brtag par bya ba dang / bstan par bya ba'i phyir de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so //
translated: which is the profound meaning of the teachings.🔽“They are intent on the ultimate truth,🔽which is the profound meaning of the teachings.🔽“The bodhisattvas who dwell on this stage🔽are always intent on the ultimate truth,🔽which is the profound meaning of the teachings.🔽“They are intent on the ultimate truth,

original: ye shes zab mo don dam tshig gis rjes snyegs shing //
analyzed: ye shes zab mo don dam tshig gis rjes snyegs shing //
translated: which is the profound meaning of the teachings.🔽“The bodhisattvas who dwell on this stage

original: sa drug rtogs pa'i yid ldan bdag nyid mnyam bzhag pa //
analyzed: sa drug rtogs pa'i yid ldan bdag nyid mnyam bzhag pa //
translated: are always intent on the ultimate truth,🔽which is the profound meaning of the teachings.🔽“They are intent on the ultimate truth,🔽which is the profound meaning of the teachings.🔽“The bodhisattvas who dwell on this stage🔽are always intent on the ultimate truth,🔽which is the profound meaning of the teachings.🔽“They are intent on the ultimate truth,🔽which is the profound meaning of the teachings.🔽“The bodhisattvas who dwell on this stage🔽are always intent on the ultimate truth,🔽which is the profound meaning of the teachings.🔽“They are intent on the ultimate truth,🔽which is the profound meaning of the teachings.🔽“The bodhisattvas who dwell on this stage🔽are always intent on the ultimate truth,🔽which is the profound meaning of the teachings.🔽“They are intent on the ultimate truth,🔽which is the profound meaning of the teachings.🔽“The bodhisattvas who dwell on this stage🔽are always intent on the ultimate truth,🔽which is the profound meaning of the teachings.🔽“They are intent on the ultimate truth,

original: shes rab thabs gnyis zung du 'brel pa mngon par sgrub //
analyzed: shes rab thabs gnyis zung du 'brel pa mngon par sgrub //
translated: which is the profound meaning of the teachings.🔽“The bodhisattvas who dwell on this stage🔽are always intent on the ultimate truth,

original: mkhas pas sa bdun spyod pa dam pa yongs su gnon //
analyzed: mkhas pas sa bdun spyod pa dam pa yongs su gnon //
translated: which is the profound meaning of the teachings.🔽“They are intent on the ultimate truth,🔽which

original: stong pa mtshan med mi smon snying rje byams dang ldan //
analyzed: stong pa mtshan med mi smon snying rje byams dang ldan //
translated: Emptiness, signlessness, wishlessness, compassion, and love,

original: chos nyid mnyam pa'i rjes 'gro sangs rgyas mchod par byed //
analyzed: chos nyid mnyam pa'i rjes 'gro sangs rgyas mchod par byed //
translated: Following the equality of reality, they make offerings to the buddhas.

original: shes pas shes byas bsod nams stobs kyis mi ngoms pas //
analyzed: shes pas shes byas bsod nams stobs kyis mi ngoms pas //
translated: With knowledge, objects of knowledge, and the power of merit, they are insatiable,

original: de phyir mkhas pa bdun pa'i sa phyogs yongs su gnon //
analyzed: de phyir mkhas pa bdun pa'i sa phyogs yongs su gnon //
translated: So the wise ones conquer the seventh ground.

original: khams gsum mngon par sgrub byed shin tu dben pa thob //
analyzed: khams gsum mngon par sgrub byed shin tu dben pa thob //
translated: They attain complete isolation, which is the manifestation of the three realms,

original: nyon mongs stobs rnams zhi zhing 'gro ba zhi la mos //
analyzed: nyon mongs stobs rnams zhi zhing 'gro ba zhi la mos //
translated: And they pacify the afflictions and long for the pacification of beings.

original: mig yor sgyu ma rmi lam mi gnyis chos spyod kyang //
analyzed: mig yor sgyu ma rmi lam mi gnyis chos spyod kyang //
translated: They engage in the practices of the Dharma, which are nondual like a reflection, an illusion, or a dream,

original: snying rje las spyod ston pa mkhas pas bdun pa gnon //
analyzed: snying rje las spyod ston pa mkhas pas bdun pa gnon //
translated: And the wise ones, through the conduct of compassion, conquer the seventh ground.

original: nam mkha'i bsam pas zhing rnams yongs spyod rnam mi rtog /
analyzed: nam mkha'i bsam pas zhing rnams yongs spyod rnam mi rtog /
translated: With the intention of space, they purify realms and are free from concepts,

original: rgyal ba'i mtshan dang ldan zhing mi g-yo chos dang ldan //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i mtshan dang ldan zhing mi g-yo chos dang ldan //
translated: Endowed with the marks of the Victorious Ones, and endowed with the immovable Dharma.

original: brjod pa'i dbyangs bral 'gro ba dgar bya don du gnyer //
analyzed: brjod pa'i dbyangs bral 'gro ba dgar bya don du gnyer //
translated: Free from the melody of expression, they strive for the benefit of beings,

original: skad cig sems kyi rgyal bas kun mkhyen yang dag gzhol //
analyzed: skad cig sems kyi rgyal bas kun mkhyen yang dag gzhol //
translated: And in an instant of mind, the Victorious Ones fully engage in omniscience.

original: chos rnams 'di @169a *//
analyzed: chos rnams 'di @169a *//
translated: These phenomena

original: dag spyad pas snang ba thob gyur pas //
analyzed: dag spyad pas snang ba thob gyur pas //
translated: Through pure conduct, they attain the light

original: 'gro ba'i don 'dod sa mchog yongs su mnan ces bya //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i don 'dod sa mchog yongs su mnan ces bya //
translated: And ascend to the supreme grounds, wishing to benefit beings.

original: de dag sa 'dir gnas shing mtha' yas sems can spyod //
analyzed: de dag sa 'dir gnas shing mtha' yas sems can spyod //
translated: Abiding on this ground, they observe the conduct of infinite beings

original: bde gshegs tshad med las mkhyen rnam par spyod pa byed //
analyzed: bde gshegs tshad med las mkhyen rnam par spyod pa byed //
translated: And engage in the knowledge of the boundless deeds of the sugatas.🔽The various realms, eons, phenomena, and numerous categories,🔽The various aspirations, thoughts, minds, and conduct,

original: zhing dang bskal pa chos grangs sna tshogs du ma dang // mos dang bsam pa sems dang spyod pa sna tshogs dang // theg pa gsum po bstan pa tshad med yang dag 'jug /
analyzed: zhing dang bskal pa chos grangs sna tshogs du ma dang // mos dang bsam pa sems dang spyod pa sna tshogs dang // theg pa gsum po bstan pa tshad med yang dag 'jug /
translated: And the boundless teachings of the three vehicles—they correctly engage in all.

original: bdag gis sems can de dag yongs su smin bya zhes //
analyzed: bdag gis sems can de dag yongs su smin bya zhes //
translated: “I will bring those beings to full maturity.”

original: de dag de ltar rnam phye shes rab lam ldan pa //
analyzed: de dag de ltar rnam phye shes rab lam ldan pa //
translated: Thus, they are discerning, possessing the path of prajñā.

original: spyod lam bzhi por mngon par brtson zhing thabs dang ldan //
analyzed: spyod lam bzhi por mngon par brtson zhing thabs dang ldan //
translated: They are diligent in the four modes of conduct and possess means.

original: sems kyi skad cig kun la byang chub yon tan sgrub //
analyzed: sems kyi skad cig kun la byang chub yon tan sgrub //
