translated: And the light of that great lotus fills the endless world systems with its radiance.

original: de la yang byang chub kyi shing chen po yongs su ston pa nas rnam pa'i mchog thams cad dang ldan pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i bar du yang dag par @216b ston to //
analyzed: de la yang byang chub kyi shing chen po yongs su ston pa nas rnam pa'i mchog thams cad dang ldan pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i bar du yang dag par @216b ston to //
translated: And there they display a great tree of awakening, up to the complete teaching of omniscience with all the best aspects.

original: rang gi lus la phyogs bcu'i nor bu dang / glog dang / nyi zla'i 'od byin gyis rlob pa nas /
analyzed: rang gi lus la phyogs bcu'i nor bu dang / glog dang / nyi zla'i 'od byin gyis rlob pa nas /
translated: They bless their own bodies with the light of the jewels, lightning, sun, and moon of the ten directions,

original: snang ba dang 'od thams cad kyi bar du byin gyis rlob bo //
analyzed: snang ba dang 'od thams cad kyi bar du byin gyis rlob bo //
translated: up to all the light and radiance.

original: kha'i dbugs kyis kyang phyogs re re'i 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas pa g-yo bar byed de /
analyzed: kha'i dbugs kyis kyang phyogs re re'i 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas pa g-yo bar byed de /
translated: And with their breath they shake endless world systems in each direction.

original: sems can rnams 'jigs par yang mi byed do //
analyzed: sems can rnams 'jigs par yang mi byed do //
translated: They do not frighten sentient beings.

original: phyogs bcur rlung gis 'jig pa dang / mes 'jig pa dang / chus 'jig pa yang byin gyis rlob la /
analyzed: phyogs bcur rlung gis 'jig pa dang / mes 'jig pa dang / chus 'jig pa yang byin gyis rlob la /
translated: They can bless the destruction of the world by wind, fire, and water in the ten directions.

original: 'dod na sems can thams cad bsam pa bzhin du gzugs kyi lus dang / gnas yongs su brgyan par byin gyis rlob bo //🔽rang gi lus la de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku byin gyis rlob ste /
analyzed: 'dod na sems can thams cad bsam pa bzhin du gzugs kyi lus dang / gnas yongs su brgyan par byin gyis rlob bo // rang gi lus la de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku byin gyis rlob ste /
translated: If they wish, they can bless the bodies and abodes of all sentient beings to be adorned as they wish.🔽They can bless the body of a tathāgata in their own body.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la rang gi lus byin gyis rlob bo //🔽de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing byin gyis rlob bo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la rang gi lus byin gyis rlob bo // de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing byin gyis rlob bo //
translated: They can bless their own body in the body of a tathāgata.🔽They can bless their own buddha realm in the body of a tathāgata.

original: rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing du de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku byin gyis rlob bo //
analyzed: rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing du de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku byin gyis rlob bo //
translated: They can bless the body of a tathāgata in their own buddha realm.

original: kye; rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye; rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: “O son of the victors!

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i sa chos kyi sprin la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni rdzu 'phrul dang / rnam par 'phrul pa 'di dag dang / gzhan yang bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong tshad med pa yongs su ston to //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i sa chos kyi sprin la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni rdzu 'phrul dang / rnam par 'phrul pa 'di dag dang / gzhan yang bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong tshad med pa yongs su ston to //
translated: In this way, the bodhisattva who is on the bodhisattva bhūmi Cloud of Dharma displays these miracles and emanations, and also countless other miracles and emanations in the trillions.

original: de nas 'khor de'i byang chub sems dpa' la la dang / lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten gyi mgon po dang / dbang @217a *//🔽phyug chen po dang / gtsang ma'i gnas su gtogs pa kha cig 'di snyam du sems te de ltar de ste /
analyzed: de nas 'khor de'i byang chub sems dpa' la la dang / lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten gyi mgon po dang / dbang @217a *// phyug chen po dang / gtsang ma'i gnas su gtogs pa kha cig 'di snyam du sems te de ltar de ste /
translated: Then, some bodhisattvas in the assembly, and some gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, Śakras, Brahmās, world guardians,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du bya ba'i spyod yul yang de ltar tshad med na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du bya ba'i spyod yul yang de ltar tshad med na /
translated: maheśvaras, and pure abodes thought this: “If the bodhisattva’s miracles and the domain of his activity are like this,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam pa ci 'dra ba zhig yod snyam pa dang / de nas byang chub sems dpa' rnam par grol ba'i zla bas 'khor de dag gi sems dang bsam pa'i rgyud shes nas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam pa ci 'dra ba zhig yod snyam pa dang / de nas byang chub sems dpa' rnam par grol ba'i zla bas 'khor de dag gi sems dang bsam pa'i rgyud shes nas /
translated: Then the bodhisattva Vimukti candra, knowing the thoughts and the mental activity of that assembly,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying po la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying po la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: said this to the bodhisattva Vajra garbha:

original: kye / rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye / rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: “O son of the victors!

original: 'khor 'di dag the tshom du gyur na /🔽de dag gi the tshom gcod pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i cho 'phrul rnam par phye ba cung zad cig mi bstan tam ////
analyzed: 'khor 'di dag the tshom du gyur na / de dag gi the tshom gcod pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i cho 'phrul rnam par phye ba cung zad cig mi bstan tam ////
translated: Since this assembly has doubts,

original: bam po lnga bcu gsum pa /
analyzed: bam po lnga bcu gsum pa /
translated: why don’t you, in order to eliminate their doubts, display a small part of the bodhisattvas’ miracles?”

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying po de'i tshe /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying po de'i tshe /
translated: Then the bodhisattva Vajra garbha,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad kyi lhun dang / rang bzhin yang dag par ston pa zhes bya ba la snyoms par zhugs so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad kyi lhun dang / rang bzhin yang dag par ston pa zhes bya ba la snyoms par zhugs so //
translated: at that time, entered the bodhisattva samādhi called “The Display of the Nature and Essence of All Buddha Realms.”

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying po /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying po /
translated: In this way, the bodhisattva Vajra garbha

original: byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad kyi lhun dang / rang bzhin yang dag par ston pa la snyoms par zhugs ma thag tu de nas de nyid kyi tshe /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad kyi lhun dang / rang bzhin yang dag par ston pa la snyoms par zhugs ma thag tu de nas de nyid kyi tshe /
translated: had just entered the bodhisattva absorption called the display of the forms and natures of all buddha realms.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor de dag thams cad dang / lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / @217b dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten gyi mgon po dang / dbang phyug chen po dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor de dag thams cad dang / lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / @217b dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten gyi mgon po dang / dbang phyug chen po dang /
translated: At that time, the entire retinue of bodhisattvas, as well as the gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, Śakra, Brahmā, the world guardians, Maheśvara,

original: gtsang ma'i gnas kyi ris su gtogs pa'i 'khor de dag thams cad; byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying po'i lus kyi nang na 'khod par rang rang gis shes par gyur te /
analyzed: gtsang ma'i gnas kyi ris su gtogs pa'i 'khor de dag thams cad; byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying po'i lus kyi nang na 'khod par rang rang gis shes par gyur te /
translated: and the entire retinue of the gods of the pure realms, all perceived themselves to be within the body of the bodhisattva Vajra garbha.

original: der sangs rgyas kyi zhing mngon du grub par shes so //
analyzed: der sangs rgyas kyi zhing mngon du grub par shes so //
translated: They perceived the formation of a buddha realm there.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de'i rnam pa dang / rgyan ji snyed pa de dag kyang bskal pa khrag khrig tshang bas kyang brjod par mi nus par mthong ste /🔽der byang chub kyi shing stong gsum brgya stong phrag bcur khyab pa'i lhun can /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de'i rnam pa dang / rgyan ji snyed pa de dag kyang bskal pa khrag khrig tshang bas kyang brjod par mi nus par mthong ste / der byang chub kyi shing stong gsum brgya stong phrag bcur khyab pa'i lhun can /
translated: He saw that the features and ornaments of that buddha realm could not be described even in a hundred trillion eons.

original: stong gsum khrag khrig yongs su tshang ba tsam du yangs shing tshad med pa'i yal ga can rtse mo shin tu mtho ba byung ste /🔽de dang rkyen du 'bab par de'i drung gi snying po byang chub la seng ge'i khri rgya chen po byung nas /
analyzed: stong gsum khrag khrig yongs su tshang ba tsam du yangs shing tshad med pa'i yal ga can rtse mo shin tu mtho ba byung ste / de dang rkyen du 'bab par de'i drung gi snying po byang chub la seng ge'i khri rgya chen po byung nas /
translated: There was a bodhi tree with a trunk that extended for a hundred thousand leagues and branches that extended for a hundred trillion leagues, with a vast and immeasurable canopy.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa mngon par shes pa'i blo gros thams cad kyi rgyal po zhes bya ba snying po byang chub tu gshegs te bzhugs pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa mngon par shes pa'i blo gros thams cad kyi rgyal po zhes bya ba snying po byang chub tu gshegs te bzhugs pa mthong ngo //
translated: In front of it was a lion throne, suitable for the bodhi tree, on which the thus-gone King of All-Seeing Intellect sat and entered the seat of awakening.

original: de ltar de na rgyan ji snyed snang bar gyur pa de dag ni bskal pa khrag khrig yongs su tshang bas kyang brjod par dka'o //
analyzed: de ltar de na rgyan ji snyed snang bar gyur pa de dag ni bskal pa khrag khrig yongs su tshang bas kyang brjod par dka'o //
translated: The ornaments that appeared there were so numerous that it would be difficult to describe them even in a hundred thousand eons.

original: des cho 'phrul chen po 'di bstan nas /🔽byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor de dag thams cad dang / lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten gyi @218a *//
analyzed: des cho 'phrul chen po 'di bstan nas / byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor de dag thams cad dang / lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten gyi @218a *//
translated: Having displayed this great miracle,🔽the entire retinue of bodhisattvas, as well as the gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, Śakra, Brahmā, the world guardians, Maheśvara, and the entire retinue belonging to the pure realms, were each returned to their own abodes.

original: mgon po dang / dbang phyug chen po dang / gnas gtsang ma'i ris su gtogs pa'i 'khor de dag thams cad so so'i gnas ji bzhin du bkod pa dang / de nas 'khor de dag thams cad ngo mtshar dang / rmad du gyur nas mi smra bar byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying po de nyid la sems shing 'khod par gyur to //
analyzed: mgon po dang / dbang phyug chen po dang / gnas gtsang ma'i ris su gtogs pa'i 'khor de dag thams cad so so'i gnas ji bzhin du bkod pa dang / de nas 'khor de dag thams cad ngo mtshar dang / rmad du gyur nas mi smra bar byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying po de nyid la sems shing 'khod par gyur to //
translated: Then, the entire retinue, filled with wonder and amazement, remained silent, contemplating only that bodhisattva Vajra garbha.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' rnam par grol ba'i zla bas /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' rnam par grol ba'i zla bas /
translated: Then the bodhisattva Vimukti candra

original: byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying po la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying po la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: The Bodhisattva Vajra garbha said to him:🔽

original: kye; rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye; rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: He said to the bodhisattva Vajra garbha, “O son of the victors!

original: ting nge 'dzin 'di'i mthu rnam par bkod pa de ni rmad du byung bar ngo mtshar che na /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin 'di'i mthu rnam par bkod pa de ni rmad du byung bar ngo mtshar che na /
translated: The display of the power of this samādhi is marvelous and wondrous.

original: kye; rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye; rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: O son of the victors!

original: ting nge 'dzin de'i ming ci zhes bya /🔽byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying pos smras pa /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de'i ming ci zhes bya / byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying pos smras pa /
translated: What is the name of this samādhi?”

original: kye; rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye; rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: The bodhisattva Vajra garbha said, “O son of the victors!

original: ting nge 'dzin 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad kyi lhun dang rang bzhin yang dag par ston pa zhes bya'o //🔽byang chub sems dpa' rnam par grol ba'i zla bas smras pa /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad kyi lhun dang rang bzhin yang dag par ston pa zhes bya'o // byang chub sems dpa' rnam par grol ba'i zla bas smras pa /
translated: This samādhi is called the display of the nature and essence of all buddha realms.”

original: kye; rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye; rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: The bodhisattva Vimukti candra said, “O son of the victors!

original: 'o na ting nge 'dzin 'di'i spyod yul dang / yul dang / rgyan ji lta bu yin /🔽byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying pos smras pa /
analyzed: 'o na ting nge 'dzin 'di'i spyod yul dang / yul dang / rgyan ji lta bu yin / byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i snying pos smras pa /
translated: What is the domain, object, and ornament of this samādhi?”

original: kye; rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye; rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: The bodhisattva Vajra garbha said, “O son of the victors!

original: byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin 'di la shin tu goms pa ni /🔽'dod na sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'di 'dra ba 'jig rten gyi khams chu klung gangg'a'i bye ma snyed dam /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin 'di la shin tu goms pa ni / 'dod na sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'di 'dra ba 'jig rten gyi khams chu klung gangg'a'i bye ma snyed dam /
translated: The bodhisattva who is very familiar with this samādhi🔽can, if he wishes, display in his own body as many buddha realms as there are grains of sand in the Ganges River,

original: de bas kyang mang du rang gi lus la ston to //
analyzed: de bas kyang mang du rang gi lus la ston to //
translated: or even more than that.

original: @218b kye; rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: @218b kye; rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: “O jinaputras!

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa chos kyi sprin la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa chos kyi sprin la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas ni /
translated: The bodhisattva who is on the bodhisattva bhūmi Cloud of Dharma

original: byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin 'di 'dra ba brgya stong shin tu mang pa rab tu 'thob ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin 'di 'dra ba brgya stong shin tu mang pa rab tu 'thob ste /
translated: attains many hundreds of thousands of such samādhis.

original: de bas byang chub sems dpa' de'i lus sam /🔽lus kyi las ni byang chub sems dpa' rgyal tshab kyi go 'phang thob cing /
analyzed: de bas byang chub sems dpa' de'i lus sam / lus kyi las ni byang chub sems dpa' rgyal tshab kyi go 'phang thob cing /
translated: Therefore, the body🔽or physical actions of that bodhisattva are not easily understood even by bodhisattvas who have attained the level of a regent

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa legs pa'i blo gros la gnas pa dag gis kyang shes par sla ba ma yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa legs pa'i blo gros la gnas pa dag gis kyang shes par sla ba ma yin no //
translated: and are on the bodhisattva bhūmi Perfect Joy.🔽His speech

original: ngag gam / ngag gi las kyang shes par sla ba ma yin no //
analyzed: ngag gam / ngag gi las kyang shes par sla ba ma yin no //
translated: or verbal actions are also not easily understood.

original: yid dam / yid kyi las kyang shes par sla ba ma yin no //
analyzed: yid dam / yid kyi las kyang shes par sla ba ma yin no //
translated: The mental activity of the bodhisattvas is also not easy to know.

original: rdzu 'phrul shes par sla ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul shes par sla ba ma yin no //
translated: The knowledge of their miracles is not easy to know.

original: dus gsum la rnam par lta ba shes par sla ba ma yin no //
analyzed: dus gsum la rnam par lta ba shes par sla ba ma yin no //
translated: The knowledge of their vision of the three times is not easy to know.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul la 'jug pa shes par sla ba ma yin no //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul la 'jug pa shes par sla ba ma yin no //
translated: The knowledge of their engagement in the domain of concentration is not easy to know.

original: ye shes kyi yul shes par sla ba ma yin no //
analyzed: ye shes kyi yul shes par sla ba ma yin no //
translated: The knowledge of their domain of wisdom is not easy to know.

original: rnam par thar pas rnam par rol pa shes par sla ba ma yin no //🔽'phrul pa'i las shes par sla ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par thar pas rnam par rol pa shes par sla ba ma yin no // 'phrul pa'i las shes par sla ba ma yin no //
translated: The knowledge of their play in liberation is not easy to know.🔽The knowledge of their miraculous activity is not easy to know.

original: byin gyi rlabs kyi las shes par sla ba ma yin no //
analyzed: byin gyi rlabs kyi las shes par sla ba ma yin no //
translated: The knowledge of their activity of blessing is not easy to know.

original: mtha'i las shes par sla ba ma yin pa nas /
analyzed: mtha'i las shes par sla ba ma yin pa nas /
translated: The knowledge of their activity of the limit of reality is not easy to know.

original: mdor bsdu na gom pa 'dor zhing 'degs pa'i las kyi bar du yang byang chub sems dpa' rgyal tshab kyi go 'phang thob cing /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na gom pa 'dor zhing 'degs pa'i las kyi bar du yang byang chub sems dpa' rgyal tshab kyi go 'phang thob cing /
translated: In brief, the knowledge of the activity of the bodhisattvas who have attained the level of the regent, from the moment they set their foot down to the moment they raise it, is not easy to know.
